24 namespace Signal {
25 
62 class Handler {
63 public:
65  Handler(void (*handler)(int) ){
66  sig_action_.sa_handler = (_sig_func_ptr)handler;
67  sig_action_.sa_flags = 0;
68  sig_action_.sa_mask = 0;
69  }
70 
72  Handler(void (*sigaction)(int, siginfo_t*, void*), int flags = 0, sigset_t mask = 0){
73  sig_action_.sa_sigaction = sigaction;
74  sig_action_.sa_flags = flags | (1<<SA_SIGINFO);
75  sig_action_.sa_mask = mask;
76  }
77 
78  const struct sigaction * sigaction() const { return &sig_action_; }
79 
80 private:
81  struct sigaction sig_action_;
82 };
83 
85 class Event {
86 public:
87 
89  Event(int signo){ signo_ = signo; }
90 
97  int trigger(pid_t pid) const { return ::kill(pid, signo_); }
98 
106  int trigger(pid_t pid, int value) const {
107  union sigval v; v.sival_int = value;
108  return ::sigqueue(pid, signo_, v);
109  }
110 
117  int trigger(pthread_t t) const { return ::pthread_kill(t, signo_); }
118 
120  int trigger(void) const { return ::pthread_kill(pthread_self(), signo_); }
121 
123  int set_handler(const Handler & handler) const;
124 
125 private:
126  int signo_;
127 
128 };
129 
170 class EventPhy: public Event {
171 public:
172 
181  EventPhy(bool persistant, int signo, int sigcode = 0, int sigvalue = 0) : Event(signo){
182  context.tid = pthread_self();
183  context.si_sigcode = sigcode;
184  context.si_signo = signo;
185  context.keep = persistant;
186  context.sig_value = sigvalue;
187  }
188 
189 
195  EventPhy(signal_callback_t context) : Event(context.si_signo){
196  this->context = context;
197  }
198 
208  hwpl_action_t action(int event, int channel = 0){
209  hwpl_action_t a;
210  a.callback = signal_callback;
211  a.context = &context;
212  a.channel = channel;
213  a.event = event;
214  return a;
215  }
216 
217 private:
218  signal_callback_t context;
219 };
220 
221 }
